node.title: How many weeks does it take to find a job near you? Search this table and see
node.description: The number of weeks it's taking to find a job is the statistic politicians should be competing over, writes Gareth Hutchens.
node.content:
["If you've seen the pieces I've been writing on the labour force framework recently, I want\u00a0to show you something.", "It has to do with the way politicians talk about the \"unemployment rate\".", "They often talk about the unemployment rate like\u00a0it's a competition, and they sow confusion by doing so.", "We\u00a0saw an example last week.", "But first, I want to talk about a statistic that politicians should compete over, because it's far\u00a0more meaningful for job seekers.", "It shows how long it's taking\u00a0to find a job in\u00a0Australia at the moment, in different areas of the country.", "
More than 100\u00a0labour markets
", "You'll often hear people talking about the \"labour market\" as though Australia has a single pool of employed and unemployed people.", "But\u00a0the world's more complicated than that.", "In fact, the\u00a0Bureau of Statistics divides Australia into 108 labour markets.", "The geographical boundary of each one is\u00a0designed to capture the labour supply (where people live) and demand (where people work) of unique markets around the country.", "ABS officials consulted experts on labour market geography and analysed the Census of Population and Housing's travel to work data to identify the different areas.", "The map below shows where the boundaries are.", "", "I've made a table (see below) that shows the length of time it's been taking\u00a0an officially \"unemployed\" person to\u00a0find a job in all 108 markets.", "I've shown the data from March 2021, because that's when Australia's economy was recovering\u00a0strongly from last year's lockdowns and\u00a0the participation rate was at an all-time high (before the Delta outbreak in June).", "I've included March data from previous years so you can see how they\u00a0compare across time.", "Bear in mind we've been living through extraordinary times in the past 18 months.", "In March this year, our international borders were still closed, net overseas migration had turned negative for the first time since 1946, job vacancies were near record highs, and billions of dollars of stimulus were circulating in the economy.", "They weren't normal times.", "Anyway, you can toggle through the pages by pressing the arrow buttons near the top right-hand corner of the table.", "I've put the headline numbers for each state and territory in different colours.", "ABS officials say the \"duration of job search\" statistic can be used to identify the number of long-term unemployed people in every labour market in the country.", "And they collect detailed data from all 108 markets to track\u00a0the fortunes of job seekers who've been looking for work for these lengths of time:", "Of particular concern are job seekers who haven't found work after a year of looking.", "If your duration of job search is 52 weeks (12 months) or more, you're considered long-term unemployed.", "ABS officials say there are consequences to being out of work for such long periods, including financial hardship and loss of skills.", "The longer someone is\u00a0unemployed the harder it becomes for them to find employment again.", "As you can see below, the\u00a0long-term unemployed have been finding it increasingly difficult to find employment over the past decade.", "That fits with the next graph, which aggregates every job seeker's experience into a single statistic.", "It shows how long it's typically taking officially unemployed people to find a job in Australia.", "Notice how the duration of the job search trended strongly downwards after the 1990s recession, but\u00a0then started trending back up after the global financial crisis in 2008.", "It's become harder for job seekers to find employment in the last 13 years.", "Isn't that the type of statistic\u00a0politicians\u00a0should be competing over?", "
A lower unemployment rate?
", "Which brings us to the last section.", "I mentioned earlier how politicians\u00a0often talk about the \"unemployment rate\" like\u00a0it's a competition\u00a0and how they sow\u00a0confusion by doing so.", "We saw an example of that last week\u00a0from our federal Treasurer.", "You'll see politicians from all parties doing it, but this is the most recent example.", "", "Note the last point Josh Frydenberg made, about the unemployment rate specifically.", "Let's consider two things.", "First, the unemployment rate does not tell you what you think it's telling you.", "As I've explained in Part 1, and Part 2, and Part 3 of this series on the labour force framework,\u00a0the unemployment rate is\u00a0not\u00a0telling you what percentage of Australians are without work each month.", "It's far more technical\u00a0and counterintuitive.", "It's telling employers and economists what percentage of people in the \"labour force\" are immediately available to fill a vacancy.", "The unemployment rate\u00a0ignores millions of other people who aren't employed\u00a0and who'd like to be working, but who can't get work at the moment.", "But when the\u00a0unemployment rate is framed in competitive terms, it makes you think that the number is telling you\u00a0what percentage of Australians are without work.", "It's very misleading.", "Second,\u00a0in the economics profession at the moment\u00a0there's a really\u00a0important debate about the concept of \"full employment\".", "According to the current orthodox theory, an economy\u00a0reaches\u00a0\"full employment\" when the\u00a0unemployment rate\u00a0falls to the\u00a0point where\u00a0inflation and wages pick up noticeably.", "This may sound strange, but it says an economy can be in \"full employment\" when the unemployment rate is 3 per cent, or 6 per cent, or 8 per cent, or 10 per cent.", "It all depends on the structure of the economy at any given moment.", "In April,\u00a0Treasury officials published a paper saying they thought the full employment level of unemployment had\u00a0changed in Australia in recent years.", "They said they used to assume the economy was in full employment when the unemployment rate was roughly 5 per cent, but now they think the economy could have been handling\u00a0an unemployment rate of\u00a04.5 to 4.75 per cent without causing a wages break-out.", "That meant they'd been miscalculating\u00a0the economy's capacity to employ more people, for the past five years or so.", "Could officials have been trying\u00a0harder to drive the unemployment rate lower for all that time?", "It put one in mind of Mr Frydenberg's Budget from 2019-20, which\u00a0based its strategy around not pushing the unemployment\u00a0lower than 5 per cent.", "See below.", "", "At any rate, the Reserve Bank thinks the unemployment rate could probably fall even lower than that now.", "That's part of the reason it's comfortable forecasting an unemployment rate of 4 per cent by the end of 2023.", "It thinks the economy can sustain it.", "But the question is:\u00a0Why can the economy sustain it?", "What's happened in the economy that means the unemployment rate might have to drop to its lowest level in decades for wages to pick up?", "Does it have to do with the creeping casualisation of the workforce? The declining power of unions? The globalisation of our labour supply?", "", "As you can see from the Wage Price Index, wage\u00a0growth has been declining steadily since the global financial crisis.", "It hit record lows last year.", "Policymakers have struggled to understand why, because it's a global phenomenon.", "But that's the context in which the RBA's forecasts for a 4 per cent unemployment rate need to be understood.", "The RBA thinks the\u00a0unemployment rate can be driven lower in coming years \u2014 due, in part, to billions of dollars of stimulus in the economy \u2014 and we'll need it to be that low for wages to pick up.", "So, see why it can be so misleading to frame the unemployment rate in competitive terms?", "A lower unemployment rate can mean a lot of things."]
